Color palettes

Background on dark elements

It is a default background, blue in colour with an opacity and a blur filter. Be careful not to superimpose the backgrounds together (increased performance problems).

.bg-default
bg-darkblueTransparent backdrop-blur-sm border-deepBlue

Main colors

Corresponds to the main colours of the interface, cyan blue being the highlight colour.

.bg-main
#56EAFF
.bg-greyBlue
#272736

Other colors

These are the secondary colours, used partially on borders, texts of inactive elements, etc.

.bg-pink
#E142A2
.bg-deepBlue
#4D4B67
.bg-lightBlue
#928EBB
.bg-bg-greyBlue
#272736
.bg-darkSea
#15172F
.bg-greyDarkBlue
#0F1F2D

Status colors

.bg-red
#FF6565
.bg-green
#93D57C
.bg-orange
#EC943F
.bg-blue
#00ABFF

Gradient colors

.bg-gr-primary
linear-gradient(270deg, #CDFBFF 0%, #85F2FF 30%, #6AEDFF 62%, #1ABAD0 100%)
.bg-gr-pink
linear-gradient(270deg, #F56772 0%, #BA6BFF 100%)

Global settings

Columns

Grids, columns must have a seperation between elements of 10px (at least). Globally, elements are separate with 10px except with really small elements (such as tiny icons, extra small buttons, etc.)

.basis-1/5 .mr-2.5
column
.basis-2/5 .mr-2.5
column
.basis-1/5 .mr-2.5
column
.basis-1/5
column
.basis-2/6 .mr-2.5 .mt-2.5
column
.basis-2/6 .mr-2.5 .mt-2.5
column
.basis-2/6 .mt-2.5
column

Border radius

The common border radius is .rounded (10px). For small elements you have to use .rounded-xs (5px) and really large .rounded-md (15px).

.rounded-xs
border-radius (3px)
.rounded
border-radius (5px)
.rounded-md
border-radius (10px)
.rounded-lg
border-radius (15px)
.rounded-full
border-radius (50%)

Box shadow

Box shadows are rarely used but can be used in some cases, particularly to make an element stand out more prominently.

.shadow-bxShadow
0 10px 20px 5px rgba(0,0,0,0.35)
.shadow-bxShadowHover
0 10px 20px 5px rgba(0,0,0,0.35)
.shadow-bxShadowSmall
0 10px 20px 5px rgba(0,0,0,0.35)

Buttons

Buttons priority

Sorted from least important (left) to most important (right). Do not have several "Most important" buttons on the same page.

Less important
Not much important
Important
Most important

Buttons size

Buttons regular size

The regular buttons are the main ones used within the platform.

Primary
Dark
Pink
Danger
Success
Warning
Info
White
Loading

Buttons smaller

Smaller buttons are used in smaller areas, it is better to use the regular size. But you can use these buttons for example with a popup if you want to reduce the size of it.

Primary
Dark
Pink
Danger
Success
Warning
Info
White
Loading

Buttons extra small

Extra small buttons are used in sub forms or very small spaces. The use of these buttons is restricted to strictly necessary cases. Only one button of that type per page is allowed.

Primary
Dark
Pink
Danger
Success
Warning
Info
White
Loading

Buttons types

Ghost buttons

This type of button is the complementary button to the main button. It is therefore used to the left of a main button. The use of this type of button is also useful in a sub-part of a form for example.

Primary
Dark
Pink
Danger
Success
Warning
Info
White
Loading

Bordered buttons

Buttons with a border are used when a main button and a ghost button are used. The use of this type of button is also useful in a sub-part of a form for example.

Primary
Dark
Pink
Danger
Success
Warning
Info
White
Loading

Light buttons

Finally, the light button is used in the case where all three types of buttons above are used. The use of this type of button is also useful in a sub-part of a form for example.

Primary
Dark
Pink
Danger
Success
Warning
Info
White
Loading

Buttons with icon

Icon buttons must be very self-explanatory otherwise it will damage the UX, the use of extra small buttons is not recommended.

Buttons disabled

Disabled buttons should be displayed (not hidden) to make it clear to the user that they do not have the rights or that they do not currently have the ability but could have it.

Primary
Dark
Pink
Danger
Success
Warning
Info
White

Situationnal buttons

Situational buttons are mainly used on pages (landing page type) and should not be used in the platform (except for advertising or temporary elements).

Gradient primary
Gradient pink
Flat primary
Flat pink
Bordered primary
Bordered pink

Forms

Fields

Input text

Labels must be placed vertically to an input. All form elements are separated with a 10 px padding (p-2.5).

This is an error message information
This is an success message information

Input search

Search elements can only be used for search input, please do not use them for something else.

Input number

Input number need some JS to work, it's currently not implemented.

Select

Select will be modified later, it's currently basic select and need some extended features such as search in it.

Textarea

Toggles

Switch

Checkbox

Radio
